column4: updating to karmic, will pidgin be removed for the new client?
no, you can still install it
what if I didn't have it?
sudo apt-get install pidgin
i use carrier, its a fork of pidgin but you can directly ask the devs for functionality
does carrier IM still exist?
totally
I stopped using it when I felt it was a failed fork
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1002384
i'd also ask in #vbox
its not maintained but is in the repo
it does work, just nobody is coding for it but the code works. I use it on my laptop just dandy
ok I know, I just thought that the vista decoration was so cool that people would create a replacement. I heard of Jasper
http://paste.ubuntu.com/678505/
755 as zykotick9 says
home, not home's content
oh, the actual folder /home ?
NO
/home/YOU
specify the folder and I can find out
ok, gimme a sec
you'll find the default as asked?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/678507/
indeed
I wanna know default permissions, not yours
those are default, i haven't touched them
in my case they are one and the same thing
that's why I am giving you it
I haven't touched mine too, dumb
weird
why would I ask at all?
you may have been chowning and chmodding you folderz and wanted the default access.
lots of reasons exists why you would ask
sorry?
not at all
confused really
can you expand the question please
you can set a lower or higher swappiness value
the swapiness value tells the kernel how often to use swap, high swapiness will make the swap space be used more, lower will try and keep apps in ram and use swap less
sure, type ren then hit TAB
sorry? what are you talking about? I have no idea
MD5 test it then use unetbootin
I'd use a true install. Its easier to work wit
you never extract the iso
oh god not another "I hate unity". Am I right?
wubi installs ubuntu to a drive image file stored in NTFS, its fine as a try before you buy but as a long term thing its not great
ok thanks, ubuntu.com is not clear about that
use unetbootin and you can make a bootable USB to test the OS with as well as install from
you can use WIndows 7 to resize its own NTFS partition to make free space to install to
grub2 can boot the ISO but you will have windows boot loader which is rubbish
I'm going to the yet somewhat working ubuntu installation now, so it's just unetbootin --help and I'll get there?
once you run unetbootin, you'll see what is going on
if you only have windows installed, you don't have grub2
I just sound to have only windows
I've been upgrading since years I think a clear install is worth now
look what I've lost completely with oneiric (please do watch): http://www.videolog.tv/video.php?id=670508
thats just some ubuntu desktop....so what?
what do you mean
that was natty, oneiric runied it
no cube no custom theme no emerald (I KNOW about emerald)
lets repeat the same ol same ol;  Gnome is not the ONLY desktop. If you install XFCE and use that, it will act and run like that
I'm sorry, what's your point exactly
what do you mean like that
you can install xfce4 and logoff, log on to the xfce session and you can replace xfwin4 with compiz
because I've been told it would be "like that" with gnome-shell or the fallback package
xfce is fully available in Oneiric and will look just like that video does
xfce will look and feel like gnome2
ok but I have a problem, through all trouble with oneiric I've deleted compiz config so how would be the steps? install xfce, then what? sorry
sudo apt-get --reinstall install compiz xfce4

basically, you think Oneiric is Unity. Which isn't true at all, its a real ignorant view. Other desktops exist and you can get a desktop just like that video with no effort at all but you think 'oneiric spoiled it'....

then it's just start configuring in the settings manager and so forth? ok thanks, maybe I'll give it a try...(still thinking about using new gnome)...if so, do you know a reliable ppa to get emerald from? I downloaded one from google search but it didn't work in oneiric
basically I think what?
emerald is dead dude
how has "oneiric runied it"?
I've seen a few hits for emerald in oneiric involving compiling it so I think its development is not dead in upstream
still no reply yet...
so how has "oneiric ruined it"? exactly?
so you speak for the whole web on that? Sorry but there's a git codebase in github iirc
http://askubuntu.com/questions/79923/how-to-install-emerald-theme-manager-and-dual-switch-between-emerald-themes-and    gets you emerald in Oneiric
will take a look at that link thanks
you still haven't answered my question....
how oneiric ruined it?
yes...
it's in the buffer waiting for flush...:)
nice

well, in natty I had customized compiz along with a theme created in gnome-appearance-settings (or -manager, can't recall), and emerald decorator with a custom theme. After upgrade to oneiric it simply disappeared, all this, that's how it ruined it
then install xfce and youwill be fine, it will still be Oneiric
you mean "Unity installed and wreked my settings"
Oneiric isn't Unity....
ok considering that
